# activePhotodiodeIndexes

**Instance Property**

The set of photodiodes in use during the sample.

## Declaration

```swift
var activePhotodiodeIndexes: IndexSet { get }
```

## Discussion

To map the spatial location of the active photodiodes, see the Apple Watch diagrams in [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample#Interpret-second-generation-PPG-sensors-data] and [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample#Interpret-third-generation-PPG-sensors].

## Accessing optical data

- **emitter**: The index of the LED in use during the sample.
- **signalIdentifier**: The identifier for a signal that photodiodes and emitters produce.
- **nominalWavelength**: The wavelength in nanometers that the emitter produces while operating at a specific temperature.
- **effectiveWavelength**: A temperature-compensated wavelength estimate in nanometers that the emitter produces.
- **samplingFrequency**: The sampling frequency of the photoplethysmogram (PPG) data in hertz.
- **nanosecondsSinceStart**: The time in nanoseconds since the system turns on the sensor.
- **conditions**: The sensor context or conditions that may affect the sample.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample.Condition**: The conditions that may occur when recording photoplethysmogram optical data.
- **noiseTerms**: The mathematical terms for computing the noise in this sample.
- **SRPhotoplethysmogramOpticalSample.NoiseTerms**: The mathematical terms that you use to compute the photoplethysmogram (PPG) noise.
- **normalizedReflectance**: The normalized photoplethysmogram (PPG) waveform.
